description: From Latin dōnātīvum (“a gratuity”), from dōnō (“I give [a present]”), from dōnum (“gift”).

adjectives.description: donative (comparative more donative, superlative most donative)

entries.meaning: Being or relating to a donation.
A gift; a largess; a gratuity.
(ecclesiastical law) A benefice conferred on a person by the founder or patron, without either presentation or institution by the ordinary, or induction by his orders.
